title: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D)
description: Assesses severity of depression symptoms. The 17-item version is a clinician-administered scale that measures depressive symptoms over the past week.

parameters.name: feelings_of_guilt
parameters.description: Self-reproach, ideas of guilt, delusions of guilt

parameters.name: suicide
parameters.description: Life not worth living, wishes were dead, suicidal ideas or attempts

parameters.name: work_and_activities
parameters.description: Loss of interest, lack of pleasure, decreased activities, productivity

parameters.name: retardation
parameters.description: Slowness of thought/speech, impaired concentration, decreased motor activity

parameters.name: anxiety_somatic
parameters.description: Physiological concomitants of anxiety (GI, cardiovascular, respiratory symptoms)

parameters.name: somatic_symptoms_general
parameters.description: Heaviness in limbs/back/head, diffuse backache, fatigue, loss of energy

parameters.name: insight
parameters.description: Awareness of being depressed and ill

ranges.interpretation: Patient shows no significant depressive symptoms. No specific intervention typically required.
Patient experiences mild depressive symptoms that may cause some distress. Consider monitoring and supportive interventions.
Patient experiences moderate depressive symptoms that interfere with daily functioning. Consider psychotherapy and/or antidepressant medication.
Patient experiences severe depressive symptoms that significantly impair functioning. Strongly consider intensive treatment including medication and psychotherapy. Assess suicide risk.

references: Hamilton M. A rating scale for depression. J Neurol Neurosurg Psychiatry. 1960 Feb;23(1):56-62. doi: 10.1136/jnnp.23.1.56.

Zimmerman M, Martinez JH, Young D, Chelminski I, Dalrymple K. Severity classification on the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale. J Affect Disord. 2013 Sep 5;150(2):384-8. doi: 10.1016/j.jad.2013.04.028.
Williams JB. A structured interview guide for the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale. Arch Gen Psychiatry. 1988 Aug;45(8):742-7. doi: 10.1001/archpsyc.1988.01800320058007.
formula: HAM-D Score = Sum of all 17 item scores (items scored 0-4 or 0-2 depending on symptom)
notes: Clinician-administered scale requiring structured or semi-structured interview
Assesses symptoms over the past week
Not intended as a diagnostic tool
Response to treatment defined as e50% score reduction
Items 18-21 may be recorded for additional clinical information but are not scored
